text: The 12-hour clock is a way of dividing the 24 hours of the day into two sections. The two halves are called ante meridiem (a.m.) and post meridiem (p.m.). Both names are from Latin and , means "before midday" and means "after midday". Each period has 12 hours and are numbered 1 or 0 to 12 or 11. There is no widely accepted convention for how midday and midnight should be represented: in English-speaking countries, "12p.m." means 12 o'clock noon, while "12a.m." means 12 o'clock midnight. == References == ==Related pages== *24-hour clock *Clock *Time Category:Time Category:Clocks
